required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis With Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Outcome of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis With Pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock: case-control study was conducted between December 2018 to April 2020. To document outcome of IPF with pregnancy.

primary_outcome.measure: any adverse events including gestational complication or disease specific complication
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of inclusion to the study till termination of pregnancy, average 9 months period
primary_outcome.description: e.g (development of respiratory failure, need for ICU admission). maternal outcome
any unfavorable neonatal outcome as low birth weight
any unfavorable neonatal outcome as prematurity or neonatal death.

arm_group.description: pregnant female with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

study_pop.textblock: Female patients were diagnosed to have IPF of childbearing age, patients were presented during pregnancy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with pulmonary diseases during pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with pulmonary diseases other than IPF and bronchial asthma were excluded.

reference.citation: American Thoracic Society; European Respiratory Society. American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society International Multidisciplinary Consensus Classification of the Idiopathic Interstitial Pneumonias. This joint statement of the American Thoracic Society (ATS), and the European Respiratory Society (ERS) was adopted by the ATS board of directors, June 2001 and by the ERS Executive Committee, June 2001. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2002 Jan 15;165(2):277-304. Review. Erratum in: Am J Respir Crit Care Med2002 Aug 1;166(3):426.
Sharma CP, Aggarwal AN, Vashisht K, Jindal SK. Successful outcome of pregnancy in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. J Assoc Physicians India. 2002 Nov;50:1446-8.
